ygData.subject: RE: Armor look
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, I just spent 2 days off and on camping the Goblin Alchemist, and finally got the Ribcage Armor. Unfortunately, it turns out it does not give any armor
ygData.messageBody:
Well, I just spent 2 days off and on camping the Goblin Alchemist, and
finally got the Ribcage Armor. Unfortunately, it turns out it does not
give any armor look, leather or otherwise. It just looks like a naked
torso.

Just thought I'd let you all know so that others don't have to waste
time camping a fairly useless object on the vague chance that it might
look cool. Not to mention the fact that monks who need the ribcage for a
quest get a little snippy when they find an enchanter camping it.


-----Original Message-----
From: Janea 'Jake' Knight [mailto:Janea@...]
Sent: Thursday, February 17, 2000 11:43 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: [eqenchanters] Armor look


From: "Janea 'Jake' Knight" <Janea@...>

Are we talking CHEST items here? If so, I am THERE baby....
I have lots of leather and plate look stuff but if I take my robe off
I've still got that mini dark
elf red bikini top... grrrr

>>>>
Any armor equipable by your true race will show up on another race you
have
taken the form of. Only problem is that you are a caster, and cant wear
much other than cloth or magical armor. Only think I can think of that
will
give you a nice armored look is Woven armor, and the ribcage armor from
the
Goblin Alchemist in Misty Thicket. Both appear as leather on your
character.
